profileText: (Brother of John Dickinson), a Delegate from Delaware and a Senator from New Jersey; born at 'Crosia-dore,' near Trappe, Talbot County, Md., April 5, 1739; moved with his parents to Dover, Del., in 1740, where he received his education from a private tutor; graduated in the first class of the University of Pennsylvania at Philadelphia in 1759; superintended his father's estates in Delaware until 1760; studied law in Philadelphia; admitted to the bar, but never practiced; moved to Trenton, N.J., in 1767; delegate to the New Jersey Provincial Congress in 1776; served in the Revolutionary War; was commissioned brigadier general in 1776, and in 1777 major general commanding the New Jersey Militia, serving in the latter capacity throughout the Revolution; Member of the Continental Congress from Delaware 1782-1783; vice president of the Council of New Jersey 1783-1784; member of the commission to choose a site for the national capital in 1784; elected to the United States Senate from New Jersey to fill the vacancy caused by the resignation of William Paterson and served from November 23, 1790, to March 3, 1793; was not a candidate for renomination; devoted his time to the care of his estates; died at his home, 'The Hermitage,' near Trenton, N.J., February 4, 1809; interment in the Friends Meeting House Burying Ground, Trenton, N.J.

creativeWork.freeFormCitationText: Dickinson, Wharton. "Philemon Dickinson: Major-General; New Jersey Militia--Revolutionary Service.'' Magazine of American History 7 (December 1881): 420-27.

researchRecord.name: In William Paca correspondence, 1777-1779. Letters describing battles, troop supply and movements during the Revolution.
1784-1861. 1 foot; ca. 350 items. Letters, legal documents, and petitions.
2 items (no date) in Tench Coxe papers.
Portrait tipped into Washington Irving's Life of George Washington, Volume VI, Miscellany, 1774-1807.
April 16, 1802. 1 letter. To William Tilghman concerning a financial transaction.

recordLocation.name: Archives and Special Collections, Campbell Library

researchRecord.name: 1 item (February 9, 1791) in Charles Roberts autograph collection.
1 letter (July 29, 1778) to William Churchill Houston and James Mott; and 1 letter to John Hancock (copy) in Alexander McDougall correspondence, 1777-1781.
1777-1792. 7 letters. Additional material in Estate papers, 1749-1951.
